column10: Description
Lauch an app from a platform shortcut on the user's desktop or start menu.
Check that the 'badge' on the app icon is empty
Check that the 'badge' on the app icon has a value
The WebApp clears the 'badge' value from it's icon
Open chrome://apps in a separage window, and drag a url (highlight & drag url from the omnibox) to the chrome://apps page
Set the app badge for the given site to a value.
The icon of the platform shortcut (on the desktop) is correct
Update the scope of site a/foo/, to the given scope
Navigates the PWA window of the SiteAFoo pwa to a given site.
Uninstall the webapp from wherever apps are listed by chrome. On WML, this is from chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is from the 'launcher'

Find the app in the app list (on desktop, this is chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is the app drawer). Check that the app opens in a window by right clicking on it to see if the "open in window" option is checked, and by launching it to see if it opens in a separate window.

Find the app in the app list (on desktop, this is chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is the app drawer). Check that the app opens in a tab by right clicking on it to see if the "open in window" option is unchecked, and by launching it to see if it opens in a browser tab (and not a window).
The app list is empty (on desktop, this is chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is the app drawer).
Check that the given app is NOT in the app list. On desktop, this is chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is the app drawer.
Check that the PWA window has a custom toolbar to show the out-of-scope url.
Check that the "Install" icon in the omnibox is not shown
Check that the "Install" icon in the omnibox is shown
A tab was created in a chrome browser window
The window was closed
A window was created.
Check that the window is a PWA window, and has minimal browser controls.
Check that the window is a PWA window, and has no browser controls.
Press the 'x' button on the custom toolbar that is towards the top of the WebApp window.
Close the WebApp window.
Install the given app using the"Create Shortcut" menu option (3-dot->"More Tools"->"Create Shortcut), and de-selecting the "Open in a window" checkbox.
Install the given app using the"Create Shortcut" menu option (3-dot->"More Tools"->"Create Shortcut), and selecting the "Open in a window" checkbox.
Add a force-installed enterprise policy app to the user profile (must be managed profile). tabbed, no platform shortcut
Add a force-installed enterprise policy app to the user profile (must be managed profile). windowed, no platform shortcut
Launch the web app by navigating to chrome://apps, and then clicking on the app icon.
Launch the web app by navigating the browser to the web app, and selecting the launch icon in the omnibox (intent picker),
Updates the display property of the manifest to 'minimal' on the given site's manifest
Navigate the browser to one of the static sites provided by the testing framework.
Navigate to a url that returns a 404 server error.
Navigates the PWA window of the SiteA pwa to a given site.
Switch to a different instance of chrome signed in to the same profile
Turn chrome sync off for "Apps": chrome://settings/syncSetup/advanced
Turn chrome sync on for "Apps": chrome://settings/syncSetup/advanced
Uninstall the webapp from the 3-dot menu in the webapp window
Remove a force-installed policy app to the user profile (must be managed profile)

Find the app in the app list (chrome://apps) and check that the given app is in the app list and is not installed. This means the icon is grey, and right clicking on it provides an 'install' option. Win/Mac/Linux only.
Find the app in the app list (chrome://apps) and install it by right-clicking on the app and selecting the 'install' option. Win/Mac/Linux only.
Add a force-installed enterprise policy app to the user profile (must be managed profile). tabbed, with platform shortcut
Add a force-installed enterprise policy app to the user profile (must be managed profile). windowed, with platform shortcut
Uncheck the "open in window" checkbox in the right-click menu of the app icon, in the app list page
Check the "open in window" checkbox in the right-click menu of the app icon, in the app list page

column3: install_create_shortcut_windowed & install_omnibox_icon & install_policy_app_windowed_no_shortcut & install_policy_app_windowed_shortcut & install_menu_option & install_create_shortcut_tabbed & install_policy_app_tabbed_shortcut & install_policy_app_tabbed_no_shortcut

column10: Install the web app configured to open in a tab. This is done by the selecting the Tools->"Create Shortcut..." menu option in the 3-dot menu, and deselecting the "open in a window" checkbox

Install the web app configured to open in a window. This is done in 3 different ways: 1) Clicking on the install icon in the omnibox, 2) Selecting the "Install _" menu option in the 3-dot menu, or 3) Selecting the Tools->"Create Shortcut..." menu option in the 3-dot menu and checking the "Open in a window" checkbox
All installation methods that result in a tabbed webapp.
All installation methods that result in a windowed webapp.

column3: install_policy_app_windowed_shortcut & install_policy_app_tabbed_shortcut & install_create_shortcut_windowed & install_omnibox_icon & install_menu_option & install_create_shortcut_tabbed

column10: All ways to launch an app that are still available for 'browser' apps.
Updates the icon field in the manifest of the website.
Launch the web app by navigating the browser to the web app, and selecting the "Launch _" menu option in the 3-dot menu.
Updates the display property of the manifest to 'browser' on the given site's manifest
A tab was not created by the last state change action
Click on the 'open in chrome' link in the 3-dot menu of the app window
create shortcut in app list
Switch to using incognito mode
Delete the shortcut that lives on the operating system
Find the app in the app list (on desktop, this is chrome://apps, and on ChromeOS, this is the app drawer). Check that the icon for the given app in the app list is correct.
Asserts that the theme color of the given app window is correct.
The color of the window is correct.
The website updates it's manifest.json to change the 'theme' color
Navigate to a page that crashes, or simulates a crashed renderer. chrome://crash
Click on a href link on the current page, where the target of the link is "_blank"
Delete the user profile.
The desktop platform shortcut has been removed.
Check that the "Create Shortcut" menu option (3-dot->"More Tools"->"Create Shortcut) is greyed out
Check that the "Create Shortcut" menu option (3-dot->"More Tools"->"Create Shortcut) is shown
Uninstalls the app from OS integration - e.g. Windows Control Panel / Start menu
Check that the window title is correct
The website updates it's manifest.json to change the 'title'
Click Accept in the App Identity Update dialog
Launch chrome://app-settings/<app-id> page
uninstall an app from app settings page, the app has to be locally installed.
Uninstall an app by user, the app can be not locally installed.
Apply WebAppSettings policy for run_on_os_login to be allowed
Apply WebAppSettings policy for run_on_os_login to be blocked
Apply WebAppSettings policy for run_on_os_login to be run_windowed
Remove  run_on_os_login policy for the app in WebAppSettings policy.
Enable run on os login from app settings page
Disable run on os login from app settings page
Check run on os login is enabled.
Check run on os login is disabled.
Check the app shown on app settings page matches the current app state.
Check the current browser naviagtion is chrome://app-settings/<app-id>
